topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Logging into the Helion Dashboard

body.p: The IP address for the Horizon interface is stored in the CAN VIP value in the /root/stackrc file on any controller node. The CAN IP contains port 5000. The CAN VIP can also be got from HLM VM in the ~/<cloud name>/clouds/<cloudname>/001/stage/net/hosts.hf file. Search for VIP.
Note: You need to import the ca.crt certificate from the /root/<cloudname> on the HLM VM. You can use any file transfer program to move the certificate file from the HLM VM to the local system.

ol.li: Ask the cloud operator for the host name or public IP address where the dashboard is located, your user name, and your password.
Open a web browser that has both JavaScript and cookies enabled.

In the address bar, enter the host name or IP address for the dashboard:
https://<CAN vip>/

On the Log In page, enter your user name and password and then click Sign In.
By default, the user name is admin. You can find the installation password for admin in the /root/stackrc file from any of the controller node. If this is the first time you log in with that user name, make sure you change the password.

If you are a non-admin user, you will only be able to select a project from the list at the top of the screen.
